channel.title: Looking for a tutorial for something like this
channel.description:
Well I believe their is a tutorial for a command that allows you to remove objects while your standing on them. Anyone know of where I would find this? I I been searching on the forums for awhile
Thanks!

item.title: Looking for a tutorial for something like this
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

Create a command that writes to a file with the x and y coordinate of the object.

Then where the objects a loaded, read that file and add them accordingly. You don’t need client.java. For PI I think you’re looking for ObjectManager.

Then you can use

checkObjectSpawn(-1, x, y ... //x and y will be read from the file created.

-1 will delete the object and you will be able to walk on it.

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for a tutorial for something like this

item.title: Looking for a tutorial for something like this

item.description:
@Kozs wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:5, topic:534271”]http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/google/tutorials/446692-adding-objects-permanently.html
Do this, but instead of needing to give an object id (In the command) just make it write -1[/quote]

Did not work, my server does not have a client.java and I searched for the method it wants and I still cant find that either

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for a tutorial for something like this
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

You should generally be able to just use the same command you use to spawn objects to remove them if you’re standing over it. Just spawning object id -1 should remove an object. At least that’s how it works in 317 as far as I’m aware.

Read full topic
